page.title: 08JOHN LEWIS GAMEKEEPER(cont)
page.content:
{JOHN LEWIS (Part 2)
The pheasants are penned with their wings tied to stop them flying away.On April 20th the first eggs arrive and they are taken to incubators.The eggs are kept in big incubators for 20 days,and are then moved to a smaller,hotter one for 4,during which time they hatch.The new chicks are kept under an electric hen-this is like an electric blanket and can keep up to two hundred chicks warm at a time.When they are six weeks old they are taken to release pens for 4-6 weeks.May to August is a very busy time-it is also a very worrying time.The biggest worry is power cuts,without heat the chicks will die in about 1 hour.As the chicks need constant attention,the gamekeeper only gets about 3 hours sleep every night.
